intro: Hoya landgrantensis, commonly known as the Landgrant Hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and its relatively slow growth rate. Its flowers, which typically range in color from white to pink, bloom in clusters and are often fragrant. Hoya landgrantensis is popular among indoor gardeners due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
